ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Amy is an excellent professor and I happy to hear she will be teaching more classes here at Yale FES inthe future.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: The discussions between students on some topics and the way discussion allowed us to work through problems faced by conservationists and try to problem solve or learn from them for future efforts.
It was very enjoyable to have the freedom to select topics of interest and learn from other students based on their interests and experiences and through open-ended discussions.

the initial classes, which tied more closely to the 1 science paper, 1 practical article, one news article format were more interesting. After spring break it became less structured and I felt less useful.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Sometimes discussions would get side tracked and I think it would be helpful to have a bit more of an idea what the goals are for each class so we can stay on topic. Kind of like the last course that Mikael and Tara led on Y2Y.

I think that instead of having all classes be student-led, it would have been nice to have a more structured first half of the course with important concepts from the readings, followed by a discussion in the second half of the course. I think our discussions were interesting but sometimes I felt like we didn't always get to a point of resolution/conclusion.
a little more structure/stronger guidelines for papers to make it about taking science and applying it, not just discussing topics in broad terms.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: Again, perhaps some sort of lecture element to the course would have helped solidify the concepts and facilitate constructive discussion

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: This course is an essential piece to my overall goals here at FES. It fits into my plan to do species conservation and helped me to think about how that goes from research and academic theory through to practice and back again.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: Because the topic was very relevant to my interests and Amy is an excellent instructor.
I took 760 and really enjoyed it, and looked forward to another seminar on conservation since none are offered at FES.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Again, I enjoyed the course but sometimes felt that we could have had more structure and moved towards some take-home lessons from each class session.
Not quite. I did get some good stuff out of the class but it would have benefitted from a little more rigor

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: The group work was helpful because it allowed me to hear other people's perspectives and ideas about the concepts and the bestway to talk about the ideas with the rest of the class.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: DO IT!!! But try to be very structured and prepared in your presentations and class discussions, ie: have a goal / output that you want to accomplish by the end of the class.
Do it! The profs are great, it's good to talk about these things with them and with your peers. very interesting stuff.
